alert.note: Alert for McPherson (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 8:44PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central South Dakota, including the following county, McPherson. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, roads and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads are under water due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported that snow melt is leading to overland flooding within the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leola, Deerfield Colony, Grassland Colony, Spring Creek Colony, Long Lake Colony, Wetonka and Elm Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
